section.text: Players organize games by writing up their goal and organizing like minded individuals with similar level characters. The length, difficulty and average rewards of a quest depends on how difficult the DM determines the task to be, and would be posted before the start of the game. Scouting an area could be a one shot, acquiring items or influence could be a couple games, and upsetting the status quo could be a campaign to itself.

subsection.text: XP are given out at the end of a quest, usually 2-6 points. To level, you need to spend XP equal to your proficiency bonus while taking a long rest while reflecting on your past adventures.

Downtime Weeks are a resource given out at the end of a quest for use in various downtime activities. (Xanathars Guide to Everything). For example, trading out a magic item you don't like for one on the evergreen list.

section.text: Use standard 27 point buy. Use races available from the races page and any relevant houserules. Valid books are PHB, SCAG, XGTE, or Artificer UA. In addition to regular equipment rules, pick a trinket from PHB page 159.
The shipwreck adventure takes place on a random island in the Shackles. Characters will need a reason to be aboard a ship.
The Colosseum aventure takes place in the capital of Akros. The players will need a reason for being in captivity, so pick either a real crime or a crime you've been falsely accused of.
In the stead of fighting in a colosseum in the capital, the players have signed up the work in the mines. However, things don't go as planned as many of the miners have disappeared of late.
As outsiders to Saltmarsh, they have become falsely accused of theivery. One person is willing to believe them, but he can only help them help themselves.
You wake up in a cold place, surrounded by stone, with only dwindling stale air to conserve. Just as you are about to sufficate, you start to hear gibbering and the scraping of stone on stone...
